lines.Vitus: "Is it just me, or does that tuft of white fur down the hall belong to whom I think?"

lines.Volesus: "And I took Cerkles as too withdrawn to come to a place like this by choice."

lines.Vitus: "I suppose I was right."

lines: We didn't expect to run into Cerkles so soon after his recent breakdown.

lines.Vitus: "I think I should approach him."

lines.Volesus: "Maybe it's best if you did this alone."

lines.Vitus: "Right. It would be a bad idea to crowd him."

lines: (Cerkles was testing the waters near a smaller pool.)

lines.Vitus: "Cerkles..."

lines.Cerkles: "Oh, it's you."

lines: There's a sharp edge in his tone.

lines.Cerkles: "And here I thought I had a moment of peace to myself."
"...Just to wash some of this filth off."
"But why bother?"
"By all means, go ahead."
"Why don't you give me another impossible task to pass judgement upon."
"After all, you know I can't say no."

lines.Vitus: "Easy now."
"I'm not here to tell you to do anything."
"You can relax."

lines.Cerkles: "...You do realise that telling somebody to relax never works, don't you?"

lines.Vitus: "Heh—"
"You're right."
"I should know that better than anybody by now, but I still couldn't stop myself from saying it. "
"You really are gifted at understanding how people feel, aren't you?"

lines: (He shifts his weight as he stands.)

lines.Cerkles: "I wouldn't say it's a gift."
"When you have the power to heal somebody, or to take their life, it doesn't really matter how they feel."
"Perhaps a murderer asks to live because he's scared of what might happen to him after he dies."
"If I can save him, is it right to do so?"
"Even if we might have a use for him?"
"Even if he saves people later on in life?"
"He still killed people, and there's no bringing those people back."

lines.Vitus: "This sounds oddly specific for a hypothetical."

lines.Cerkles: "Well, it is."
"When I was alive, I spent most of my nights thinking of hundreds of situations, trying to figure out what was best to do—having the abilities that I had.",

lines.Vitus: "If it bothers you so much, why didn't you stop using magic altogether?"

lines.Cerkles: "Because inaction is still a choice."
"The problem was always having a choice."
"Sometimes I used to fantasise about ""accidentally"" disgracing Makari-Hari's name in such a pathetic way that he'd find a way to take my powers forever."
"But that never happened, so I spent each day a coward... and after a certain point, it felt like every day faded into the next.",
"And there was a kind of comfort in that paralysis."
"But I never stayed numb for long, so I was back to making choices again.",
"After all, I really did want to be part of something bigger than myself."
"And now I am, whether I choose to be or not."

lines.Vitus: "I think I understand why you became a Hero now..."
"That being said, I'm still going to give you the right tochoose when I give you orders "

lines.Cerkles: ",...That isn't fair."

lines.Vitus: "No, what isn't fair is foisting responsibility on somebody else for all of your choices!"
"You have powers that people would kill for."
"Maybe you didn't ask for them, or maybe you didn't understand what you were going through to get them..."
"But I would save a life if I could."
"I wouldn’t worry about if my actions caused harm in the long term."
"The people we help aren't our responsibility, not forever."

lines.Cerkles: "Aren't they?"

lines.Vitus: "It's no wonder you drove yourself mad."
"I'll summon you if I need you."
"But I'm going now."

lines.Cerkles: "...Wait."
"...What?"
"...I'm sorry that this is what I am."
"You're not the first to be angry with me."
"And I believe that I deserve the anger."
"I must be narcissistic to believe that my decisions shape the world more than anybody else's do."
"Everybody has to make choices just as difficult as my own."
"...I believed in the dream of a better world for so long."

lines.Vitus: "...Did you?"

lines.Cerkles: "I did."
"And I've seen so much pain and so much bloodshed over the course of time that it's hard to think that I'm doing enough."
"And any wrong choice that I make is a part of the reason why the good we can do is never enough."

lines.Vitus: "....But life is not a dream, though."
"We stumble through it and I think most of us try to do our best."
"There are plenty of things I regret—I suppose—but I'd really regret to never have had a choice in anything I ever did."
",Maybe that's why it's so hard for me to understand you."

lines.Cerkles: "I wish I could shut out the thoughts, like you do.",

lines: 84,v,c20_v_V-U-BO,"When you put it like that, it sounds like you're calling me stupid."

lines.Cerkles: "N-Not at all."
"It must be much clearer without all the noise."

lines.Vitus: "That's kind of you."

lines.Cerkles: "I hear that I'm revered for that."

lines.Vitus: "The world needs more kindness."
"...Mind if I wash with you?"

lines.Cerkles: "Well, you're already here. "
"Sounds like an easy decision to me."

lines.Vitus: "You'd be surprised how easy most of your decisions can be when you're not a paragon."
